name: Neoplasm
description: An abnormal growth of cells that can be benign (non-cancerous) or malignant (cancerous), which can form on the vocal cords or in the respiratory tract.

name: Vocal Paralysis
description: Loss of movement of the vocal cords due to nerve damage, which can result in difficulties in speaking and controlling the voice.

name: Phonotrauma
description: Injuries to the vocal cords caused by excessive, abusive, or incorrect vocal use, often resulting in voice alterations and throat pain.

name: Chronic Laryngitis
description: Persistent inflammation of the vocal cords, often caused by prolonged exposure to irritants such as cigarette smoke or chemicals, causing persistent hoarseness and dry cough.

name: Spasmodic Dysphonia
description: A neurological disorder characterized by involuntary spasms of the vocal cord muscles, resulting in a jerky or trembling voice and difficulty speaking fluently.

name: Contact Granuloma
description: An inflammatory lesion of the vocal cord mucosa, often caused by repeated vocal trauma or chemical irritation, resulting in voice alteration and a sensation of constriction in the throat.

name: Vocal Cyst
description: An abnormal fluid formation on the vocal cords, which can cause persistent hoarseness and voice alteration.

name: Leukoplakia
description: Whitish or thick lesions on the vocal cords or throat mucosa, which can be precancerous and require close medical monitoring.

name: Laryngeal Papillomatosis
description: A viral disease characterized by the growth of small benign growths on the vocal cords, which can cause persistent hoarseness and breathing difficulties.

name: Subglottic Hematoma
description: Accumulation of blood in the subglottic region of the airways, often caused by vocal trauma, resulting in voice alteration and breathing difficulties.
